instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1990: What is A1990? A1990 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2018, 2019 with EMC3215, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01041, 820-01814..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Speaker issue
threads.message:
Hello, got a MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> from a customer the issue is thee left speaker.

Basically he went to another repair store and they replaced 3 times the speaker and all of them sound distorted/buzzing. 
I found a little corrosion around <CHIP>U6400</CHIP> and replaced it 2 time but I got no differences. 

What else should I check?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Speaker issue
threads.message: Did you test with known good speaker assembly?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Speaker issue
threads.message:
Yes, I tried from my personal speaker and sounds distorted.
It is not a speaker issue sadly but something on the logic

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Speaker issue
threads.message:
Check/replace <CAPACITOR>C6411</CAPACITOR>-14 and <CAPACITOR>C6461</CAPACITOR>-64.
Noise comes from tweeter, or woofer?
You can remove corresponding coil, to check each independently.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Speaker issue
threads.message: it comes from the woofer because when I removed the <CHIP>U6400</CHIP> and tested there was no buzz sound going on.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Speaker issue
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Speaker issue
threads.message: it is better but not perfect what else can I try?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Speaker issue
threads.message:
one side of <RESISTOR>R6481</RESISTOR> was not well soldered. Fixed the issue. 
Thanks a lot
